intro: Rhazya greissii, commonly known as the Arabian coffee plant, is a perennial shrub native to the arid regions of the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Rhazya greissii is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, showing resistance to drought and high temperatures. It has been traditionally used in local medicine for its purported health benefits.
